text: Cor Brom (27 August 1932 – 29 October 2008) was a Dutch football player and manager. ==Playing career== During his playing career, Brom played with Zwarte Schapen, VSV, Limburgia and Telstar.Oud-Ajaxtrainer Cor Brom overleden - Parool ==Managerial career== After retiring as a player, Brom managed Vitesse Arnhem from 1969 to 1972, Fortuna SC from 1972 to 1976, Sparta Rotterdam from 1976 to 1978, Ajax from 1978 to 1979, RWD Molenbeek from 1981 to 1982, and FC Zwolle from 1982 to 1984. He was dismissed by Ajax's new chairman Ton Harmsen in 1979 after allegedly taking payments and gifts (a horse and the meat of a whole pig), meant for the players, from an amateur side who played Ajax in pre-season.Karbonades en schnitzels ("Pork chops and schnitzels" - NRC ==Later life and death== Brom died in Amsterdam on 29 October 2008, of Parkinson's disease. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2008 deaths Category:Footballers from Amsterdam Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Dutch footballers Category:SC Telstar players Category:Dutch football managers Category:SBV Vitesse managers Category:Fortuna Sittard managers Category:Sparta Rotterdam managers Category:AFC Ajax managers Category:K.R.C. title: Cor Brom
